pr_title: Add method to wait and return established session's ID

timeline.bodyText: Why not put the lock/check current thread logic inside this method? This will help to simplify the code. As for the callers require a different return, you can handle those differences in the caller. But the lock and thread check can be put here.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: Synced with @jiajunwang offline. Either works OK. We agree to add a locking layer for returning session, so there are less code changes and it is easier to maintain.

replies.bodyText:
The other issue identified with HuiZhi is that 698 _zkclient.subscribeStateChanges(this) is not safe for another reason.
The event can be like this:
1/ Zookeeper (client) created, and syconnect comes and then the constructor of ZKClient finishes.
2/ line 698 _zkclient.subscribeStateChanges(this) executed.
3/ Zookeeper expired and reconnect happens in ZKClient, then synconnnected get delivered.
4/ HandleNewSesssion get delivered.
5/ _zkCllient.waitForEstablishedSession executed and handleNewSession get called the second time.
So the gist is still we should provide a constructor of ZKCLient with the stateChanges callback register at one shot. @jiajunwang what is your take?
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText: As we discussed offline, the issue is not newly introduced in this PR. And it is not becoming worse. I agree that we need to fix it. But not in this PR.
